ADC.title: ADC Declaration
ADC.description: Indicates this document is an ADC declaration

class.title: Class
class.description: Indicates this document is an ADC declaration

schemaVersion.title: Schema version
schemaVersion.description: Version of ADC Declaration schema this declaration uses

id.title: Declaration ID
id.description: Unique identifier for this declaration (max 255 printable chars with no spaces, quotation marks, angle brackets, nor backslashes)

Analytics_Profile.title: Analytics Profile test...
Analytics_Profile.description: HTTP Analytics profile with configurable options

collectGeo.title: Collect Countries
collectGeo.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics of the names of the countries from which that traffic was sent

collectClientSideStatistics.title: Collect Client-Side Statistics
collectClientSideStatistics.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics regarding the HTTP request and response times

collectUrl.title: Collect URL
collectUrl.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics of requested URLs

collectIp.title: Collect Client IP Addresses
collectIp.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics of the IP addresses of where the traffic came from

collectSubnet.title: Collect Client Subnet
collectSubnet.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics of client subnets

collectUserAgent.title: Collect User Agent
collectUserAgent.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics about browsers used to send traffic

collectOsAndBrowser.title: Collect Operating System and Browser
collectOsAndBrowser.description: Specifies that the system collect statistics about the OSs and Browsers used to send requests

collectResponseCode.title: Collect Response Code
collectResponseCode.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics about the distribution of HTTP response codes returned by the servers

collectMethod.title: Collect Method
collectMethod.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics about the distribution of HTTP methods found in requests

collectMaxTpsAndThroughput.title: Collect Max TPS and Throughput
collectMaxTpsAndThroughput.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics for the maximum number of transactions per second, and the maximum amount of traffic moving through the system, both request and response throughput values

collectPageLoadTime.title: Collect Page Load Time
collectPageLoadTime.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics of the round-trip latency between client end-users and the servers

collectUserSession.title: Collect User Sessions
collectUserSession.description: Specifies that the system collects statistics of the number of unique user sessions in the application traffic, as determined by the value of the configured HTTP cookies found in the requests

collectedStatsInternalLogging.title: Collected Statistics Internal Logging
collectedStatsInternalLogging.description: Specifies that statistics logs are stored in the system

collectedStatsExternalLogging.title: Collected Statistics External Logging
collectedStatsExternalLogging.description: Specifies that statistics logs are stored on a remote server

capturedTrafficInternalLogging.title: Captured Traffic Internal Logging
capturedTrafficInternalLogging.description: Specifies that the system captures a portion of the application traffic and sends it to a remote server

capturedTrafficExternalLogging.title: Captured Traffic External Logging
capturedTrafficExternalLogging.description: Specifies that the system captures a portion of the application traffic which can then be viewed on the System >> Logs >> Captured Transactions screen

sessionCookieSecurity.title: Session Cookie Security
sessionCookieSecurity.description: Specify whether to secure session cookies

sessionTimeoutMinutes.title: Session Timeout in Minutes
sessionTimeoutMinutes.description: The number of minutes of user non-activity ot allow before the system considers the session to be over

notificationBySyslog.title: Notification by syslog
notificationBySyslog.description: Specifies that the system sends notifications to the syslog

notificationBySnmp.title: Notification by SNMP
notificationBySnmp.description: Specifies that the system sends notifications as SNMP traps

notificationByEmail.title: Notification by Email
notificationByEmail.description: Specifies that the system sends notifications by e-mail

notificationEmailAddresses.title: E-mail Notification Recipients
notificationEmailAddresses.description: The e-mail addresses of a recipient to whom the system should send email notifications

publishIruleStatistics.title: Publish iRule Statistics
publishIruleStatistics.description: Specifies that the system collects and displays statistics according to the expressions written in an iRule

urlsForStatCollection.title: URLs for Statistics Collection
urlsForStatCollection.description: Specifies the requested URLs for collecting statistics

countriesForStatCollection.title: Countries for Statistics Collection
countriesForStatCollection.description: Specifies the countries for collecting statistics

subnetsForStatCollection.title: Subnets for Statistics Collection
subnetsForStatCollection.description: Specifies the requested subnets for collecting statistics

Analytics_TCP_Profile.title: Analytics TCP Profile
Analytics_TCP_Profile.description: TCP Analytics profile with configurable options

collectCity.title: Collect City
collectCity.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the city with which traffic was exchanged

collectContinent.title: Collect Continent
collectContinent.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the continent with which traffic was exchanged

collectCountry.title: Collect Country
collectCountry.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the country with which traffic was exchanged

collectedByClientSide.title: Collected By Client Side
collectedByClientSide.description: Specifies that system collects statistics on the client side

collectedByServerSide.title: Collected By Server Side
collectedByServerSide.description: Specifies that system collects statistics on the server side

collectedStatsExternalLogging.title: Collected Statistics External Logging
collectedStatsExternalLogging.description: Specifies that statistics logs are stored on a remote server

collectedStatsInternalLogging.title: Collected Statistics Internal Logging
collectedStatsInternalLogging.description: Specifies that statistics logs are stored in the system

collectNexthop.title: Collect Next Hop Ethernet Address
collectNexthop.description: Specifies that the system saves the address to which the traffic is being routed

collectPostCode.title: Collect Post Code
collectPostCode.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the postcode with which traffic was exchanged

collectRegion.title: Collect Region
collectRegion.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the region with which traffic was exchanged

collectRemoteHostIp.title: Collect Remote Host IP
collectRemoteHostIp.description: Specifies that the system collects IP addresses with which traffic was exchanged

collectRemoteHostSubnet.title: Collect Remote Host Subnet
collectRemoteHostSubnet.description: Specifies that the system saves the address of the subnet with which traffic was exchanged

template.description: This is a deprecated property found in older BIG-IP AS3 declarations and it will be ignored

class.title: Class
class.description: Indicates this document is an BIG-IP AS3 declaration

$schema.description: URL of schema against which to validate. Used by validation in your local environment only (via Visual Studio Code, for example)

id.title: Declaration ID
id.description: Unique identifier for this declaration (max 255 printable chars with no spaces, quotation marks, angle brackets, nor backslashes)

action.title: Action
action.description: Specifies the action to the performed on the ADC declaration

Basic_Auth.title: Basic Authentication
Basic_Auth.description: Describes the basic authentication to access a resource

username.description: Specifies the user name for authentication

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

Bearer_Token.title: Bearer Token Authorization
Bearer_Token.description: Describes using a bearer token to access a resource

CA_Bundle.title: CA Bundle
CA_Bundle.description: Bundle of one or more PKI Certificate-Authority certificates

bundle.description: Reference to a CA bundle or string of PEM encoded certificates

Capture_Filter.title: Capture Filter
Capture_Filter.description: Criteria determining when the system captures a portion of the application traffic

requestCapturedParts.title: Request Captured Parts
requestCapturedParts.description: Specifies which parts of the request data the system captures

responseCapturedParts.title: Response Captured Parts
responseCapturedParts.description: Specifies which parts of the response data the system captures

dosActivity.title: DoS Activity
dosActivity.description: Specifies whether the system captures traffic data mitigated by the DoS Layer 7 Enforcer, or traffic regardless of DoS activity

capturedProtocols.title: Captured Protocols
capturedProtocols.description: Specifies whether the system captures traffic data that is sent using any protocol, or a specific type of protocol

capturedReadyForJsInjection.title: Qualified for JavaScript Injection
capturedReadyForJsInjection.description: Specifies whether the system captures all traffic data from all transactions or only from transactions that qualify for JavaScript injection

virtualServers.title: Virtual Servers
virtualServers.description: Specifies whether the system captures traffic data sent from/to all virtual servers, or only from/to specific virtual servers.  If none are specified then all will be collected

nodeAddresses.title: Node Addresses
nodeAddresses.description: Specifies whether the system captures traffic data sent from/to all nodes, or only from/to specific nodes.  If none are specified then all will be collected

responseCodes.title: Response Status Codes
responseCodes.description: Specifies whether the system captures traffic data based on the HTTP response status codes that the requests return.  If none are specified then all will be collected

methods.title: HTTP Methods
methods.description: Specifies whether the system captures traffic data based on the HTTP method that was requested.  If none are specified then all will be collected

urlFilterType.title: URL Filter Type
urlFilterType.description: Specifies how the URL path prefixes are interpreted

urlPathPrefixes.title: URL Path Prefixes
urlPathPrefixes.description: Specifies URLs the filter type is to be applied to.  If none are specified then all will be collected

userAgentSubstrings.title: User Agent Substrings
userAgentSubstrings.description: Specifies whether the system captures traffic sent from all browsers, or only traffic sent from a specific browser

clientIps.title: Client IP Addresses
clientIps.description: Specifies the client IP addresses to collect stats for.  If none are specified, then all will be collected

requestContentFilterSearchPart.title: Request Content Filter Search Part
requestContentFilterSearchPart.description: Specifies the part of the request that should be filtered by the search string

requestContentFilterSearchString.title: Request Content Filter Search String
requestContentFilterSearchString.description: Specifies the string the request should be searched for

responseContentFilterSearchPart.title: Response Content Filter Search Part
responseContentFilterSearchPart.description: Specifies the part of the response that should be filtered by the search string

responseContentFilterSearchString.title: Response Content Filter Search String
responseContentFilterSearchString.description: Specifies the string the response should be searched for

privateKey.title: Private Key
privateKey.description: Private key matching certificate's public key (optional)

chainCA.title: CA chain
chainCA.description: Bundle of one or more CA certificates in trust-chain from root CA to certificate (optional)

passphrase.title: Passphrase
passphrase.description: If supplied, used to decrypt privateKey at runtime (optional)

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

pkcs12.title: PKCS#12 certificate+key
pkcs12.description: The pkcs12 value which may be a url to fetch the binary file from or base64 encoded string

keyImportFormat.title: PKCS#12 Private Key Format
keyImportFormat.description: Determines the format in which the private key is saved. Default is PKCS#8.

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: Key has to be decrypted and re-encrypted as part of extraction, resulting in a diff. Set to true to exclude the pkcs12 object for subsequent deployments.

internalOnly.title: BIG-IP AS3 internal use only
internalOnly.description: BIG-IP AS3 uses this property internally. Any values supplied here will be ignored

staplerOCSP.title: OCSP Stapler
staplerOCSP.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to OCSP Stapler declaration (optional)

issuerCertificate.description: Specifies the name of the issuer certificate for this certificate

dnsResolver.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to DNS resolver used to resolve hostnames in client requests
dnsResolver.title: DNS resolver

responderUrl.description: Specifies the absolute URL that overrides the OCSP responder URL obtained from the certificate's AIA extension(s). This should be a HTTP based URL.
responderUrl.title: Responder URL

signingCertificate.description: Specifies the certificate object to use for OCSP responders that require the request to be signed
signingCertificate.title: Request Signing Certificate Object

signingHashAlgorithm.description: Specifies a hash algorithm used to sign an OCSP request
signingHashAlgorithm.title: Request Signing Hash Algorithm

timeout.description: Specifies the time interval (in seconds) that the BIG-IP waits for before ending the connection to the OCSP responder. The default value is 8
timeout.title: Timeout

Ciphers.title: Ciphers
Ciphers.description: Ciphersuite selection string (ciphers and cipherGroup are mutually exclusive, only use one).

Constants.title: Constants
Constants.description: Named values for (re-)use by declaration objects

allowReuse.description: If true (default), cryptogram may be reused by different declaration objects, WHICH MAY POSE A SECURITY RISK!
allowReuse.title: Allow reuse

archiveId.description: Read-only property present when you GET a declaration from configuration system.  Archived versions of declaration are identified by a combination of 'id' and 'archiveId'
archiveId.title: Archive ID

archiveTimestamp.description: Read-only property present when you GET a declaration from configuration system.  Indicates when this version (see archiveId) of declaration was archived
archiveTimestamp.title: Archive timestamp

dryRun.description: Boolean that indicates if this declaration will be run as a dry-run. If true, the declaration will NOT make any changes to the system, but will respond with whether or not it would.
dryRun.title: Dry-Run Option

fortune.description: If true, BIG-IP AS3 will activate Zoltar mode and read you your fortune
fortune.title: Fortune

logLevel.title: Log level
logLevel.description: Controls the amount of detail in logs produced while configuring this Tenant (default is whole-declaration Controls/logLevel value)

trace.description: If true, BIG-IP AS3 creates a detailed trace of the configuration process for this Tenant for subsequent analysis (default is whole-declaration Controls/trace value).  Warning:  trace files may contain sensitive configuration data
trace.title: Trace

traceResponse.title: Trace Response
traceResponse.description: If true, the response will contain the trace files

userAgent.title: User Agent
userAgent.description: User Agent information to include in TEEM report

Data_Group.title: Data group
Data_Group.description: Data group definition with configurable options

externalFilePath.title: External file path
externalFilePath.description: Specifies the location (URI) from where the records will be copied

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates data group in every AS3 declaration deployment. If true, AS3 creates the data group on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards

keyDataType.title: Key data type
keyDataType.description: Specifies the type of record keys the data group contains. If string, the value will be escaped by default

separator.title: Separator
separator.description: Specifies the character(s) that separate the record key and value

storageType.title: Storage type
storageType.description: Toggles whether the data group is internal or external

key.title: Record key
key.description: The key for referencing the record

DNS_Logging_Profile.title: DNS Logging Profile
DNS_Logging_Profile.description: Configures a Domain Name System (DNS) logging profile

includeCompleteAnswer.description: Specifies whether the system logs the complete answer from the query

includeQueryId.description: Specifies whether the system logs the ID of the query

includeSource.description: Specifies whether the system logs the source (the BIG-IP system that receives the packet)

includeTimestamp.description: Specifies whether the system logs the timestamp of when the query was created

includeView.description: Specifies whether the system includes the view in the log

logQueriesEnabled.description: Specifies whether the system logs queries

logResponsesEnabled.description: Specifies whether the systems logs responses

Enum_Country_Analytics.title: Enum values for Analytics_Profile
enum: Congo, The Democratic Republic of the
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

F5_String.title: Common definition for ways to define a value that needs to be resolved
F5_String.description: The value can be either a string, text property, base64 property, url property, etc.
F5_String.errorMessage: must be a string or an object with a single property of 'text', 'base64', 'url', or 'copyFrom'. Example formats: 'your_string', { "text": "your_string" }, { "base64": "base64_value" }, { "url": "your_url" }, or { "copyFrom": "pointer_value" }

HTTP_Acceleration_Profile.title: HTTP acceleration profile
HTTP_Acceleration_Profile.description: HTTP acceleration profile with configurable options

agingRate.description: Rate at which a cache entry ages

cacheSize.description: The maximum size (in megabytes) for the cache.

ignoreHeaders.description: Which cache disabling headers will be ignored by the system

insertAgeHeaderEnabled.description: Age and date headers are inserted into the response when enabled

maximumAge.description: How long (in seconds) the system will consider the cached content valid

maximumEntries.description: The maximum number of entries that can reside in the cache

maximumObjectSize.description: The largest object (in bytes) that the system will cache

metadataMaxSize.description: The maximum size (in megabytes) of the metadata cache

minimumObjectSize.description: The smallest object (in bytes) that the system will cache

parentProfile.description: The profile that this profile inherits values from

uriExcludeList.description: A list of URIs that will be excluded from the cache

uriIncludeList.description: A list of URIs that will be cacheable

uriIncludeOverrideList.description: A list of URIs that should be cached even though they may normally not be due to existing constraints

uriPinnedList.description: A list of URIs that are kept in the cache regardless of maxAge or expiry settings

HTTP_Compress.title: HTTP Compression profile
HTTP_Compress.description: HTTP Compression profile with configurable options

allowHTTP10.description: Specifies whether to forward HTTP 1.0 requests/responses (default false)

bufferSize.title: Buffer size
bufferSize.description: Maximum number of response octets to buffer before deciding whether to apply compression (default 4096)

contentTypeExcludes.title: Content-Type exclude list
contentTypeExcludes.description: List of response Content-Type values which BIG-IP AS3 should not compress.  Values are regular expressions that match Content-Type strings

contentTypeIncludes.title: Content-Type include list
contentTypeIncludes.description: List of response Content-Type values which BIG-IP AS3 should compress.  Values are regular expressions that match Content-Type strings

cpuSaver.description: If true (default), system will reduce compression rate when CPU utilization exceeds cpuSaverHigh threshold and increase it when CPU utilization falls below cpuSaverLow threshold
cpuSaver.title: CPU saver

cpuSaverHigh.description: CPU utilization percentage (default 90) above which BIG-IP AS3 should moderate compression
cpuSaverHigh.title: CPU-saver %high

cpuSaverLow.description: CPU utilization percentage (default 75) below which the system returns compression to normal
cpuSaverLow.title: CPU-saver %low

gzipLevel.title: GZIP level
gzipLevel.description: Compression level (default 1); higher values produce greater compression but use more CPU cycles

gzipMemory.title: GZIP memory level
gzipMemory.description: Compression memory allocation in kilobytes (default 8), should be a power of two

gzipWindowSize.title: GZIP window size
gzipWindowSize.description: Compression window size in kilobytes (default 16), should be a power of two

keepAcceptEncoding.title: Keep Accept-Encoding header
keepAcceptEncoding.description: Specifies that the system does not remove the Accept-Encoding header from an HTTP request (default false)

minimumSize.description: BIG-IP AS3 will not compress responses of fewer octets than this (default 1024)
minimumSize.title: Minimum size to compress

preferMethod.description: Select preferred compression method (default gzip, strongly recommended)
preferMethod.title: Prefer method

selective.description: If true, BIG-IP AS3 will only compress a response when an iRule attached to the virtual server requests it (default is false, meaning BIG-IP AS3 will compress responses which meet the criteria in this profile)
selective.title: Selective mode

uriExcludes.title: URI exclude list
uriExcludes.description: List of request URI's for which BIG-IP AS3 should not compress responses.  Values are regular expressions that match request URI strings

uriIncludes.title: URI include list
uriIncludes.description: List of request URI's for which BIG-IP AS3 should compress responses.  Values are regular expressions that match URI strings

varyHeader.description: If true (default), a Vary header will appear in compressed responses
varyHeader.title: Vary header

multiplexStatusReuse.title: Multiplex Status Reuse
multiplexStatusReuse.description: Specifies what status codes will reuse connections from Multiplex. Default value is 200 206.

allowBlankSpaceAfterHeaderName.description: Specifies whether to allow blank space in an HTTP header between the header name and the separator colon in an HTTP request or response. Requires TMOS version 16.1 or newer.
allowBlankSpaceAfterHeaderName.title: Allow Blank Space After Header Name

allowedResponseHeaders.description: By default BIG-IP AS3 passes HTTP headers in responses from pool members to clients unaltered.  You may list names of allowed response headers here and BIG-IP AS3 removes any you do not list from responses.
allowedResponseHeaders.title: Allow response headers

cookiePassphrase.title: Cookie encryption passphrase
cookiePassphrase.description: Used to create secret key for cookie encryption (when missing, BIG-IP AS3 uses a system-generated key)

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

encryptCookies.title: Encrypt cookies
encryptCookies.description: List cookies to encrypt en-route to the client and decrypt en-route to a pool member

enforceRFCCompliance.description: BIG-IP LTM performs basic RFC compliance checks as described in the latest RFC for the HTTP protocol. If a client request fails these checks, then the connection is reset. Requires TMOS version 15.0 or newer.
enforceRFCCompliance.title: Enforce RFC Compliance

fallbackRedirect.title: Fallback Redirect
fallbackRedirect.description: Domain name (or IP address) of service (if any) to which BIG-IP AS3 should redirect a request when no pool member is responsive or selected pool member returns a fallbackStatusCode

fallbackStatusCodes.description: When a pool member responds to a request with one of these HTTP status codes (for example, 500), redirect the client to the fallbackRedirect
fallbackStatusCodes.title: Fallback status codes

hstsIncludeSubdomains.description: If true then HSTS headers (see hstsInsert) will tell clients to apply HSTS settings to the hostnames of this service and all their possible subdomains.  Warning: an incorrect value here can make multiple websites unreachable, not just this service
hstsIncludeSubdomains.title: Include subdomains in HSTS

hstsInsert.description: If true, insert HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) headers into responses sent to clients (default false).  Warning:  misconfiguration of HSTS can make a website unreachable
hstsInsert.title: Insert HSTS headers

hstsPeriod.description: If hstsInsert is true, this value tells each client how long (in seconds; default 7862400 equals 91 days) to wait before refreshing HSTS settings for this service.  Warning:  once a client receives erroneous HSTS settings it will ignore any attempt to correct them until this period has expired
hstsPeriod.title: Period of HSTS

hstsPreload.description: If true, include the domain for the web site associated with this HTTP profile in the browser's preload list. This forces the client to send packets over SSL/TLS.
hstsPreload.title: Include domain in preload list

requestChunking.title: Request chunking
requestChunking.description: Controls handling of HTTP payload chunking in requests from clients (default is 'preserve'). Note: 'selective' and 'preserve' will be translated to 'sustain' when TMOS version is 15.0 or newer and 'sustain' will be translated to 'preserve' on older TMOS versions.

responseChunking.title: Response chunking
responseChunking.description: Controls handling of HTTP payload chunking in responses from pool members (default 'selective' adapts to most situations). Note: 'selective' and 'preserve' will be translated to 'sustain' when TMOS version is 15.0 or newer and 'sustain' will be translated to 'selective' on older TMOS versions.

rewriteRedirects.title: Rewrite redirects
rewriteRedirects.description: In selected Location-header values (default none) of redirect responses from pool members, change protocol HTTP to HTTPS before passing redirects to clients

insertHeader.title: Insert header
insertHeader.description: You may insert one header into each request before BIG-IP AS3 sends it to a pool member.  The header value may be a simple string or the result of an iRules TCL expression (for example, [IP::client_addr]).  This is the most efficient way to insert a single header; to insert multiple headers use an iRule or an Endpoint policy

name.title: Header name
name.description: Name of the HTTP header to insert

value.title: Header value
value.description: Value of the HTTP header to insert

knownMethods.title: Known methods
knownMethods.description: List of HTTP request methods BIG-IP AS3 should recognize as normal.  Any method not in this list will provoke the 'unknownMethodAction' action

maxRequests.title: Maximum requests per connection
maxRequests.description: When BIG-IP AS3 has processed more than this number of requests through a connection, the system closes it.  Default 0 means permit unlimited requests

multiplexTransformations.title: Multiplex transformations
multiplexTransformations.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 adjusts request headers to work properly when the virtual server uses a Multiplex profile

otherXFF.title: Other XFF headers
otherXFF.description: Names of request headers to treat as equivalent to X-Forwarded-For (see trustXFF)

pipelineAction.description: Default 'allow' means clients may pipeline HTTP/1.1 requests to pool members which support pipelining.  Otherwise, 'reject' prevents pipelining, and 'pass-through' causes the connection to switch to pass-through mode when the system detects pipelining
pipelineAction.title: Pipeline action

profileWebSocket.description: Deprecated. Specifies the WebSocket profile that will be used on Services alongside this HTTP profile. When the 'profileWebSocket' property is used on a Service, it will supersede this property.

proxyConnectEnabled.description: Determines if a proxy connection profile will be created
proxyConnectEnabled.title: Proxy connection enabled

proxyType.description: Default value 'reverse' is usually appropriate.  You may use 'transparent' when virtual server will handle a mix of HTTP and non-HTTP traffic.  You may use 'explicit' when clients will ask ADC to proxy connections to arbitrary remote services
proxyType.title: Proxy type

whiteOutHeader.title: White-out header
whiteOutHeader.description: You may name one request header you want whited-out of each request before BIG-IP AS3 sends it to a pool member.  To remove more than a single named header, use an iRule or an Endpoint policy.  (Whiting-out a header leaves its name but replaces its value in the request with space characters (ASCII 0x20) to avoid changing the length of the headers.)

xForwardedFor.title: Insert X-Forwarded-For
xForwardedFor.description: If true, insert an X-Forwarded-For header carrying the client IP address into each HTTP request sent to a pool member (default true)

serverHeaderValue.title: Server header value
serverHeaderValue.description: Server header value to place in responses generated by the ADC itself (not obtained from a pool member)

trustXFF.description: If true, WAF (ASM) and AVR may trust X-Forwarded-For headers found in incoming requests and report statistics using client IP addresses appearing in them (default false).  Use this feature only when you control upstream gateway(s)
trustXFF.title: Trust X-Forwarded-For

unknownMethodAction.description: Default 'allow' means clients may make HTTP requests using unknown methods.  Otherwise, 'reject' means to discard any unknown-method request and reject the client connection, and 'pass-through' causes the connection to switch to pass-through mode upon the first unknown-method request
unknownMethodAction.title: Unknown method action

viaHost.description: Hostname to place in Via header when viaRequest or viaResponse is 'append'
viaHost.title: Via hostname

viaRequest.description: Controls treatment of Via: headers in requests from clients.  When set to 'append' BIG-IP AS3 requires viaHost
viaRequest.title: Via request control

viaResponse.description: Controls treatment of Via: headers in responses from pool members.  When set to 'append' BIG-IP AS3 requires viaHost
viaResponse.title: Via response control

webSocketMasking.description: Deprecated. WebSocket stream data is always masked from client to ADC and from ADC to server.  Default value 'unmask' makes stream data passing through visible to ADC security policy and/or iRules attached to the service.  'selective' unmasks stream data only when a security policy is attached.  'preserve' passes data through masked (unreadable by security policy).  'remask' causes different masking keys to be used on client and server sides. When specified the property 'profileWebSocket' supersedes this property.
webSocketMasking.title: WebSocket masking

webSocketsEnabled.description: Deprecated. When true, allow clients to initiate WebSocket connections (default false). When specified the property 'profileWebSocket' supersedes this property.
webSocketsEnabled.title: WebSockets Enabled

HTTP_Profile_Explicit.title: HTTP Profile Explicit
HTTP_Profile_Explicit.description: Extra HTTP profile configurable options when proxyType is 'explicit'

maxHeaderCount.title: Maximum header count
maxHeaderCount.description: When the number of headers in an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

maxHeaderSize.title: Maximum header size
maxHeaderSize.description: When the total size in octets of the headers of an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

truncatedRedirects.title: Truncated redirects
truncatedRedirects.description: If false (default) elide malformed redirects from pool members, otherwise pass them to client

resolver.title: DNS resolver
resolver.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to DNS resolver used to resolve hostnames in client requests

bigip.title: BIG-IP resolver
bigip.description: Pathname of existing BIG-IP net DNS resolver

doNotProxyHosts.title: Do-not-proxy hosts
doNotProxyHosts.description: When a client makes a (proxy-type) request to some host on this list, that request will simply be load-balanced to a pool member (without DNS resolution).  This is ineffective for HTTPS requests

tunnelName.title: Tunnel name
tunnelName.description: Name of tunnel used for outbound CONNECT requests

defaultConnectAction.title: Default CONNECT action
defaultConnectAction.description: By default (value 'deny') the system refuses CONNECT requests from clients except when there is a virtual server listening to the tunnelName tunnel to accept and process them (typically to authorize and/or intercept outbound TLS connections).  Value 'allow' will let clients CONNECT to arbitrary remote services

routeDomain.title: Exit route domain
routeDomain.description: Proxy requests will leave the ADC from a Self IP in this route domain (default 0)

connectErrorMessage.title: Connect-error message
connectErrorMessage.description: Message returned to client when the system cannot establish a proxy connection.  May include iRules TCL expressions
connectErrorMessage.default: Unable to connect to host in proxy request

dnsErrorMessage.title: DNS-error message
dnsErrorMessage.description: Message returned to the client when the system cannot resolve the hostname in the request.  May include iRules TCL expressions
dnsErrorMessage.default: Cannot resolve hostname in proxy request

badRequestMessage.title: Bad-request message
badRequestMessage.description: Message returned to client when proxy request is erroneous. May include iRules TCL expressions

badResponseMessage.title: Bad-response message
badResponseMessage.description: Message returned to client when proxy request is erroneous. May include iRules TCL expressions

ipv6.title: IPv6 first priority
ipv6.description: Specifies the relative order of IPv4 and IPv6 DNS resolutions for URIs. If false (default), then the system performs IPv4 lookup before IPv6.

HTTP_Profile_Reverse.title: HTTP Profile Reverse
HTTP_Profile_Reverse.description: Extra HTTP profile configurable options when proxyType is 'reverse'

maxHeaderCount.title: Maximum header count
maxHeaderCount.description: When the number of headers in an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

maxHeaderSize.title: Maximum header size
maxHeaderSize.description: When the total size in octets of the headers of an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

truncatedRedirects.title: Truncated redirects
truncatedRedirects.description: If false (default) elide malformed redirects from pool members, otherwise pass them to client

HTTP_Profile_Transparent.title: HTTP Profile Transparent
HTTP_Profile_Transparent.description: Extra HTTP profile configurable options when proxyType is 'transparent'

maxHeaderCount.title: Maximum header count
maxHeaderCount.description: When the number of headers in a request or response exceeds this value (default 32), take the excessX...Headers action

maxHeaderSize.title: Maximum header size
maxHeaderSize.description: When the total size in octets of the headers of request or response exceeds this value (default 16384), take the oversizeX...Headers action

excessClientHeaders.title: Excess client headers action
excessClientHeaders.description: When a client request violates maxHeaderCount, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

excessServerHeaders.title: Excess server headers action
excessServerHeaders.description: When a pool member response violates maxHeaderCount, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

oversizeClientHeaders.title: Oversize client headers action
oversizeClientHeaders.description: When a client request violates maxHeaderSize, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

oversizeServerHeaders.title: Oversize server headers action
oversizeServerHeaders.description: When a pool member response violates maxHeaderSize, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

truncatedRedirects.title: Truncated redirects
truncatedRedirects.description: If true (default) pass malformed redirects to client

activationMode.title: Activation Mode
activationMode.description: This setting specifies the condition that will cause the BIG-IP system to handle an incoming connection as an HTTP/2 connection.

concurrentStreamsPerConnection.title: Concurrent streams per connection
concurrentStreamsPerConnection.description: The number of concurrent connections to allow on a single HTTP/2 connection.

connectionIdleTimeout.title: Connection idle timeout
connectionIdleTimeout.description: The number of seconds that a HTTP/2 connection is left open idly before it is closed.

enforceTlsRequirements.title: Enforce TLS requirements
enforceTlsRequirements.description: Enable or disable enforcement of TLS requirements.

frameSize.title: Frame size
frameSize.description: The size of the data frames, in bytes, that the HTTP/2 protocol sends to the client.

headerTableSize.title: Header table size
headerTableSize.description: The size of the header table, in KB, for the HTTP headers that the HTTP/2 protocol compresses to save bandwidth.

includeContentLength.title: Include content length
includeContentLength.description: Enable to include content-length in HTTP/2 headers.

insertHeader.title: Insert header
insertHeader.description: This setting specifies whether the BIG-IP system should add an HTTP header to the HTTP request to show that the request was received over HTTP/2.

insertHeaderName.title: Insert header name
insertHeaderName.description: This setting specifies the name of the header that the BIG-IP system will add to the HTTP request when the Insert Header is enabled.

receiveWindow.title: Receive window
receiveWindow.description: The flow-control size for upload streams, in KB.

writeSize.title: Write size
writeSize.description: The total size of combined data frames, in bytes, that the HTTP/2 protocol sends in a single write function.

IP_Address.title: IP Address
IP_Address.errorMessage: must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address

IP_Address_Range.title: IP Address Range
IP_Address_Range.errorMessage: must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address (or address range)

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: If true (default), expand backquoted variables in iRule

IRule_Core.title: iRule Core definition
IRule_Core.description: Reference to an iRule or text of an iRule

JWE.title: JWE cryptogram
JWE.description: A value in a cryptogram which is a Flattened JWE JSON Serialization object. If 'miniJWE' is true then enc=(none|f5sv) only (in JOSE header)

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the ciphertext in every BIG-IP AS3 declaration deployment. If true, BIG-IP AS3 creates the ciphertext on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards

miniJWE.title: Mini JWE
miniJWE.description: If true (default), object is an f5 mini-JWE

protected.title: JOSE header
protected.description: NOTE: F5 recommends you leave the property protected empty or not modify the default value. This property protected is a marker. Changing this value from the default indicates that your secrets have been encrypted with SecureVault. E.g. default value `eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJub25lIn0` becomes `eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJmNXN2In0. If you see 'protected'='eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJmNXN2In0', 'ciphertext' contains base64url-encoded SecureVault cryptogram. JOSE header: alg=dir, enc=(none|f5sv); default enc=none (encoded default is 'protected'='eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJub25lIn0', use with secret simply base64 url-encoded into 'ciphertext').

clientTimeout.title: Client timeout
clientTimeout.description: Number of seconds allowed for a client to transmit enough data to select a server when you have late binding enabled. Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

idleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
idleTimeout.description: Number of seconds connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion. Value -1 (not recommended) means indefinite. Value 0 means immediate

keepAliveInterval.title: Keep-alive interval
keepAliveInterval.description: Number of seconds between keep-alive probes. A value of 0 seconds disables the feature.

maxSegmentSize.title: MSS
maxSegmentSize.description: Sets MSS advertised to peer. Value 0 (default) will set MSS automatically in proportion to interface MTU. Default 0 is usually the best choice

synCookieAllowlist.title: Syn Cookie Allowlist
synCookieAllowlist.description: Specifies whether or not to use a SYN Cookie Allowlist when doing software SYN Cookies. This means not doing a SYN Cookie for the same src IP address if it has been done already in the previous tm.flowstate.timeout (30) seconds. The default value is disabled.

synCookieEnable.title: SYN cookie enable
synCookieEnable.description: Enables syn-cookies capability on this virtual server. If true (default), the system may use SYN cookies to avert connection-table overflow (for example, from DoS attacks)

Label.title: Label
Label.description: Optional friendly name for this object

failureInterval.title: Failure Interval
failureInterval.description: Specifies an interval, in seconds. If the number of failures specified in the failures option occurs within this interval, the system marks the pool member as being unavailable.

failures.title: Failures
failures.description: Specifies the number of failures that the system allows to occur, within the time period specified in the failureInterval property, before marking a pool member unavailable. The multiple tmm processes use a per-process number to calculate failures, depending on the specified load. For example, for the Round Robin load balancing method, if there are N tmm processes and M pool members, and the Failures property is set to L, then up to N*M*L+1 failures can occur before the system marks the node as down. Specifying a value of 0 disables this option. A failure can be either a failure to connect or a failure of the pool member to respond within the time specified in the responseTime property.

responseTime.title: Response Time
responseTime.description: Specifies an amount of time, in seconds. If the pool member does not respond with data after the specified amount of time has passed, the number of failures in this interval increments by 1. Specifying a value of 0 disables this option.

retryTime.title: Retry Time
retryTime.description: Specifies the amount of time in seconds after the pool member has been marked unavailable before the system retries to connect to the pool member. Specifying a value of 0 disables this option.

base.title: Base
base.description: Specifies the location in the LDAP tree from which the monitor starts the health check

chaseReferrals.title: Chase Referrals
chaseReferrals.description: Specifies, whether, upon receipt of an LDAP referral entry, the referral is followed

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Specifies an LDAP key which the monitor searches

mandatoryAttributes.title: Mandatory Attributes
mandatoryAttributes.description: Specifies whether the target must include attributes in its response to be considered up

slowRampTime.title: Slow Ramp Time
slowRampTime.description: Sets the ramp-up time (in seconds) to gradually ramp up the load on newly added or freshly detected up pool members

serviceDownAction.title: Service Down Action
serviceDownAction.description: The action to take if the service associated to this pool is marked down

minimumMembersActive.title: Minimum Members Active
minimumMembersActive.description: Pool is down when fewer than this number of members are up

addressDiscovery.title: Address discovery
addressDiscovery.description: Selects how server (node) addresses are discovered

rateLimit.title: Rate Limit
rateLimit.description: Value zero prevents use of member

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.description: Specifies the weight of the pool member for load balancing purposes

servers.title: Advanced server addresses
servers.description: Same as serverAddresses, but allowing for further specification of each node

shareNodes.description: If enabled, nodes are created in /Common instead of the tenant's partition

Property_Always_Set.title: Always set
Property_Always_Set.description: If true, set cookie with every HTTP response (default false)

Property_Cookie_Method.title: Method
Property_Cookie_Method.description: Selects cookie processing method (default is insert)

Property_Cookie_Name.title: Cookie name
Property_Cookie_Name.description: Cookie name (for method 'insert', default (empty-string) yields system-generated name)

Property_Duration.title: Duration
Property_Duration.description: Lifetime of persistence record (seconds, default 0 means indefinite)

Property_Encrypt.title: Encrypt cookie
Property_Encrypt.description: If true, prevent disclosure of (or tampering with) ADC info in cookie (default false, to reduce latency)

Property_Idle_Timeout.title: Idle timeout
Property_Idle_Timeout.description: Number of seconds (may not be 0) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion

Property_Loose_Close.title: Loose close
Property_Loose_Close.description: When true, system closes a loosely-initiated connection when the system receives the first FIN packet from either the client or the server

Property_Loose_Initialization.title: Loose initialization
Property_Loose_Initialization.description: When true, system initializes a connection when it receives any TCP packet, rather than requiring a SYN packet for connection initiation

Property_Match_Across_Pools.title: Match across pools
Property_Match_Across_Pools.description: Specifies that the system can use any pool that contains this persistence record

Property_Match_Across_Virtual_Addresses.title: Match across virtual addresses
Property_Match_Across_Virtual_Addresses.description: Specifies that all persistent connections from the same client IP address go to the same node

Property_Match_Across_Virtual_Ports.title: Match across virtual ports
Property_Match_Across_Virtual_Ports.description: Specifies that all persistent connections from a client IP address that go to the same virtual IP address also go to the same node

Property_Override_Connection_Limit.title: Override Connection Limit
Property_Override_Connection_Limit.description: If true, do not enforce pool member connection limit for persisted connections

Property_Persistence_Method.title: Persistence method
Property_Persistence_Method.description: You may customize each basic persistence method. Note: 'tls-session-id' method is only supported for Service_HTTP, Service_HTTPS and Service_TCP

Property_Proxy_Buffer_High.title: Proxy buffer (high)
Property_Proxy_Buffer_High.description: The system closes the receive window when the number of octets in proxy buffer rises above this value

Property_Proxy_Buffer_Low.title: Proxy buffer (low)
Property_Proxy_Buffer_Low.description: The system opens the receive window when the number of octets in proxy buffer falls below this value

Property_PVA_Acceleration.title: PVA acceleration
Property_PVA_Acceleration.description: Specifies the preferred acceleration mode for the Packet Velocity ASIC (PVA) if the platform supports PVA acceleration. Full - Specifies the system applies full PVA acceleration when possible. Partial - Specifies the system applies partial PVA acceleration. None - Specifies the system does not use PVA acceleration. Dedicated - Unconditionally enables ePVA acceleration for all TCP FastL4 connections. Inactive, but established connections are not removed from the ePVA to guarantee low latency forwarding for future packets.

Property_Reset_On_Timeout.title: Reset On Timeout
Property_Reset_On_Timeout.description: Specifies whether to reset connections on timeout

Property_Send_Buffer_Size.title: Send buffer size
Property_Send_Buffer_Size.description: Maximum size of send buffer in bytes

Property_TCP_Close_Timeout.title: TCP Close timeout
Property_TCP_Close_Timeout.description: Specifies a TCP close timeout in seconds. Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

Property_TCP_Handshake_Timeout.title: TCP Handshake timeout
Property_TCP_Handshake_Timeout.description: Specifies a TCP handshake timeout in seconds. Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

Property_Ttl.title: TTL
Property_Ttl.description: Requested cookie lifetime (seconds, default 0 means session cookie)

RateLimit.title: Rate limit
RateLimit.description: Specifies the maximum number of connections per second allowed for a virtual server

Remark.title: Remark
Remark.description: Arbitrary (brief) text pertaining to this object. Allows 0-64 chars, excluding only control characters, double-quote, and backslash. This is permissive enough that you should worry about XSS attacks

Resource_URL.title: Resource URL
Resource_URL.description: The URL for a required resource

ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the URL will be fetched in each BIG-IP AS3 declaration deployment. If true, the resource will be created on the first deployment, but not on additional deployments

skipCertificateCheck.description: Skip verification of SSL certificates (default false)

url.description: URL from which to retrieve value

Secret.title: Secret value
Secret.description: A value: (a) in a cryptogram in this object; (b) in a cryptogram elsewhere in this declaration; or (c) available from a URL

allowReuse.title: Allow reuse
allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

reuseFrom.title: Reuse from
reuseFrom.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to another JWE cryptogram in this declaration to copy

url.title: URL
url.description: URL from which secret should be fetched

Secret_Resource_URL.title: Secret Resource URL
Secret_Resource_URL.description: Describes the URL to remote resource and optional parameters

url.description: URL from which to retrieve value

skipCertificateCheck.description: Skip verification of SSL certificates (default false)

profileBotDefense.description: Attaches a Bot Defense profile to the service
Attaches a Bot Defense profile to the service

snatAddresses.title: SNAT addresses
snatAddresses.description: List of SNAT addresses-- may include both IPv4 and IPv6

SNAT_Translation.title: SNAT_Translation
SNAT_Translation.description: Configures explicit secure network address translation (SNAT) address

address.title: Address
address.description: The IP address of the SNAT translation

adminState.title: Administration State
adminState.description: Specifies the state of the SNAT translation

arpEnabled.title: Enable ARP
arpEnabled.description: Specifies that the NAT sends ARP requests

ipIdleTimeout.title: IP Idle Timeout
ipIdleTimeout.description: Specifies time in seconds that connections to an IP address initiated using a SNAT address are allowed to remain idle before being automatically disconnected. Specifying 'indefinite' prevents the connection from timing out.

maxConnections.title: Maximum Connections
maxConnections.description: Specifies a limit on the number of connections a translation address must reach before it no longer initiates a connection. A value of 0 indicates the setting is disabled.

tcpIdleTimeout.title: TCP Idle Timeout
tcpIdleTimeout.description: Specifies time in seconds that TCP connections initiated using a SNAT address are allowed to remain idle before being automatically disconnected. Specifying 'indefinite' prevents the connection from timing out.

trafficGroup.title: Traffic Group
trafficGroup.description: Specifies the traffic group which the SNAT_Translation belongs

udpIdleTimeout.title: UDP Idle Timeout
udpIdleTimeout.description: Specifies time in seconds that UDP connections initiated using a SNAT address are allowed to remain idle before being automatically disconnected. Specifying 'indefinite' prevents the connection from timing out.

ackOnPush.title: Acknowledge On Push
ackOnPush.description: When enabled, significantly improves performance to Microsoft Windows and macOS peers who are writing out on a very small send buffer. The default value is true.

enhancedLossRecovery.title: Enhanced Loss Recovery
enhancedLossRecovery.description: When enabled, specifies that the system uses enhanced loss recovery to recover from random packet losses more effectively. The default value is true.

fastOpen.title: Fast Open
fastOpen.description: When enabled, permits TCP Fast Open, allowing properly equipped TCP clients to send data with the SYN packet. This option has no effect on server-side TCP profiles. The default value is true.

minimumRto.title: Minimum RTO
minimumRto.description: Specifies the minimum TCP retransmission timeout in milliseconds. The default value is 1000 milliseconds.

nagle.title: Nagle's algorithm
nagle.description: Value 'enable' means to use Nagle's algorithm to minimize the transmission of short TCP segments (note:  Nagle's algorithm yields undesirable results with many application protocols).  Value 'auto' (default) means the ADC will choose automatically whether to enable Nagle's algorithm.  Value 'disable' averts application of Nagle's algorithm

pktLossIgnoreBurst.title: Packet Loss Ignore Burst
pktLossIgnoreBurst.description: Specifies the probability of performing congestion control when multiple packets in a row are lost even if the packetLossIgnoreRate was not exceeded. Valid values are 0 to 32. The default is 0, meaning that the system should perform congestion control if any packets are lost. Higher values decrease the chance of performing congestion control.

pktLossIgnoreRate.title: Packet Loss Ignore Rate
pktLossIgnoreRate.description: Specifies the threshold of packets lost per million at which the system should perform congestion control. Valid values for n are 0 to 1,000,000. The default is 0, meaning the system should perform congestion control if any packet loss occurs. If you set the ignore rate to 10 and packet loss for a TCP connection is greater than 10 per million, congestion control occurs.

proxyOptions.title: Proxy Options
proxyOptions.description: Specifies, when enabled, that the system advertises an option, such as a time-stamp to the server only if it was negotiated with the client. The default value is false.

verifiedAccept.title: Verified Accept
verifiedAccept.description: When enabled, the system verifies that the pool member is available to accept the connection by sending the server a SYN before responding to the client's SYN with a SYN-ACK.

zeroWindowTimeout.title: Zero Window Timeout
zeroWindowTimeout.description: Specifies the timeout in milliseconds for terminating a connection with an effective zero length TCP transmit window. The timeout starts when the peer advertises a zero length TCP window or when enough data has been sent to fill the previously advertised window. The timer is canceled when a non-zero length window is received. The default is 20000 milliseconds.

trustCA.title: Trust CA
trustCA.description: CAs trusted to validate server certificate; generic (default) or else BIG-IP AS3 pointer to declaration of CA Bundle

certificates.title: Certificates
certificates.description: Primary and (optional) additional certificates (order is significant, element 0 is the primary certificate)

TranslateClientPort.title: Translate client port
TranslateClientPort.description: A value of true (boolean) or 'change' allows the system to handle the source port translation of the connection. A value of false (boolean) or 'preserve' allows the system to change the port if it's in use, while the 'preserve-strict' option does not
TranslateClientPort.errorMessage: must be a boolean or a string with value of 'change', 'preserve', or 'preserve-strict'

TranslateServerAddress.title: Translate server address
TranslateServerAddress.description: If true (default), make server-side connection to server address (otherwise, treat server as gateway to virtual-server address)

UDP_Profile.title: UDP Profile
UDP_Profile.description: Configures a User Datagram Protocol (UDP) profile

allowNoPayload.title: Allow empty payload
allowNoPayload.description: When true, forward UDP datagrams with empty payloads (default false)

bufferMaxBytes.title: Buffer maximum-bytes
bufferMaxBytes.description: Limit to number of octets which the system may buffer for a UDP flow (default 655350)

bufferMaxPackets.title: Buffer maximum-packets
bufferMaxPackets.description: Limit to number of packets which the system may buffer for a UDP flow (default 0)

datagramLoadBalancing.title: Datagram load-balancing
datagramLoadBalancing.description: When true, process UDP datagrams independently, without recognizing flows (default false)

idleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
idleTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 60) flow may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion. Value 0 allows system to recover per-flow resources whenever convenient (always safe with UDP). Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

ipDfMode.title: IP DF mode
ipDfMode.description: Controls DF (Don't Fragment) flag in outgoing datagrams. Value 'pmtu' (default) sets DF based on IP PMTU value. Value 'preserve' copies DF from received datagram. Value 'set' forces DF true in all outgoing datagrams. Value 'clear' forces DF false in all outgoing datagrams

ipTosToClient.title: IP TOS/DSCP to client
ipTosToClient.description: Specifies the IP TOS/DSCP value in packets sent to clients (default 0). Numeric values in this property are decimal representations of eight-bit numbers, of which the leftmost six bits are the DSCP code per rfc2474 (and the rightmost two bits reserved). You may have to calculate the value of this property by multiplying a DSCP code, such as CS5+EF = 46, by four, to obtain the 'ipTosToClient' value, such as 184. Value 'pass-through' sets DSCP from the initial server-side value. Value 'mimic' copies DSCP from the most-recently received server-side packet (allowing DSCP to vary during the life of a connection)

linkQosToClient.title: Link QOS to client
linkQosToClient.description: Specifies the Layer-2 QOS value in packets sent to clients (default 0). Ethernet-type networks recognize numeric codes from 0 to 7. Value 'pass-through' sets QOS from the initial server-side value

proxyMSS.title: Proxy MSS
proxyMSS.description: When true, MSS advertised on the server side will match that negotiated with the client, if permitted by MTU and other constraints (default false)

ttlIPv4.title: TTL for IPv4
ttlIPv4.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv4 datagrams

ttlIPv6.title: TTL for IPv6
ttlIPv6.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv6 datagrams

ttlMode.title: TTL mode
ttlMode.description: Controls IP TTL in outgoing datagrams. Value 'set' forces TTL to value of property 'ttlIPv4' or 'ttlIPv6' as appropriate. Value 'proxy' forces TTL to the default value for IPv4 or IPv6 as appropriate. Value 'preserve' copies TTL from received datagram. Value 'decrement' sets TTL to one less than received datagram's TTL

useChecksum.title: Use checksum
useChecksum.description: When true, system will validate UDP checksums for IPv4 datagrams (default false). Checksums are always validated for IPv6

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the policy in every BIG-IP AS3 declaration deployment. If true, BIG-IP AS3 creates the policy on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards

enforcementMode.title: Enforcement Mode
enforcementMode.description: Overrides the enforcement mode setting of the WAF policy

compressMode.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer. Specifies the mode that controls what compression operations are performed. Setting 'masking' to 'preserve' and 'compressMode' to 'typed' will not be allowed because it results in an invalid configuration.
compressMode.title: Compress Mode

compression.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer and used when compressMode is 'typed'. Specifies whether compress will be negotiated with the endpoint.
compression.title: Compression

masking.description: Specifies the masking operation for WebSocket frames
masking.title: Masking

maximumWindowSize.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer and used when compressMode is 'typed'. Specifies the maximum sliding window for compression negotiated with the endpoint.
maximumWindowSize.title: Maximum Window Size

noDelay.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer and used when compressMode is 'typed'. Specifies whether data should be buffered for efficient compression, or compressed without delay.
noDelay.title: No Delay
